pr_title: Fail deployment for Gauges in RequestScoped beans

timeline.message:
Fail deployment for Gauges in RequestScoped beans
Warn for Gauges not in ApplicationScoped or Singleton beans

Signed-off-by: Tomas Langer <tomas.langer@oracle.com>

Revert code formatting

Signed-off-by: Tomas Langer <tomas.langer@oracle.com>

timeline.bodyText: Is failing preferable to warning (and then not adding the gauge) in this case?
timeline.author: tjquinno

replies.bodyText:
See: https://github.com/eclipse/microprofile-metrics/pull/367/files
In general disabling a feature means it works differently from what user wanted - in this case it cannot work and the annotation is wrong, so I think an exception is the right way to process it.
replies.author: tomas-langer
